member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.EnableFatalError
member.summary: If false will not do anything nor log anything.

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.EnableThreadedLogging
member.summary: If true, the will use one extra thread per instance to persist logs. This means the log methods like will return indicating the information is in a queue to be logged. This greatly increases the performance in the event your is under heavy load, for example, if your logging database is under strain, your application will continue to perform, but logs will be queued.

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.EnableThreadedLoggingOutput
member.summary: Doesn't do anything just yet

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.ModuleName
member.summary: A friendly identifier to help identify different applications if they use the same .

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.Instance
member.summary: A friendly identifier to help identify different instances of the same application, such as a development or production instance of the same application.

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.EnvironmentInstance
member.summary: A friendly identifier to help identify different environments of the same application, such as deployments to different geo-graphical locations of the same application.

member.name: P:cdmdotnet.Logging.Configuration.ILoggerSettings.SqlDatabaseLogsConnectionStringName
member.summary: The key of the item that holds the name of the connection string to use.

member.summary: The name of the table to use.

member.summary: If true, all log calls will be telemetered.

member.summary: If true, all log calls will be telemetered.

member.name: T:cdmdotnet.Logging.ITelemetryHelper
member.summary: Send events, metrics and other telemetry.

member.summary: Send an event.
member.param: A name for the event.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.summary: Send a metric.
member.param: Metric name.
Metric value.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.summary: Send an Exception
member.param: The exception to log.
Additional values associated with this exception.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ITelemetryHelper.TrackDependency(System.String,System.String,System.DateTimeOffset,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Send information about an external dependency call in the application, such as a call to a database.
member.param: External dependency name.
Dependency call command name.
The time when the dependency was called.
The time taken by the external dependency to handle the call.
True if the dependency call was handled successfully.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ITelemetryHelper.TrackDependency(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTimeOffset,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Send information about an external dependency call in the application, such as a web-service call
member.param: External dependency type.
External dependency target.
External dependency name.
Dependency call command name.
The time when the dependency was called.
The time taken by the external dependency to handle the call.
Result code of dependency call execution.
True if the dependency call was handled successfully.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ITelemetryHelper.TrackRequest(System.String,System.DateTimeOffset,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Send information about a request handled by the application.
member.param: The request name.
The time when the page was requested.
The time taken by the application to handle the request.
The response status code.
True if the request was handled successfully by the application.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.

member.summary: Send information about a request handled by the application.
member.param: The request name.
The ID of user accessing the application.
The time when the page was requested.
The time taken by the application to handle the request.
The response status code.
True if the request was handled successfully by the application.
Named string values you can use to search and classify events.
The application-defined session ID.

member.name: T:cdmdotnet.Logging.VeryPrimitiveLogger
member.summary: Provides a set of methods that help you log events relating to the execution of your code.

member.name: T:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger
member.summary: Provides a set of methods that help you log events relating to the execution of your code. The additionalData parameter generally will map to something like a column is using a using the TKey as the column name and the TValue asn the column value Or TKey as the property name and the TValue asn the property value. The metaData Will be serialised to a JSON string and if using a logging will be stored to a column named 'MetaData'.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogSensitive(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: This is for logging sensitive information, to the using the specified . Depending on the implementation this won't be obscured or encrypted in anyway. Use this sparingly.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogInfo(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: This is for logging general information, effectively the least amount of information you'd want to know about a system operation, to the using the specified . Don't abuse this as you will flood the logs as this would normally never turned off. Use or for reporting additional information.

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogProgress(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Writes logging progress information such as "Process X is 24% done" to the using the specified .

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogDebug(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Writes diagnostic information to the using the specified .

member.summary: Writes warnings, something not yet an error, but something to watch out for, to the using the specified .

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogError(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Writes errors, something handled and to be investigated, to the using the specified .

member.name: M:cdmdotnet.Logging.ILogger.LogFatalError(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Writes fatal errors that have a detrimental effect on the system, to the using the specified .
